isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (355.6 MM) STAMPED ANGLE-SPRING CLUTCH - ADJUSTMENT INSTRUCTIONS - INTERNAL ADJUSTMENT MECHANISMS AND INSTRUCTIONS

svcproc.title: INTERNAL ADJUSTMENT MECHANISMS AND INSTRUCTIONS
svcproc.para: There are three types of adjustment mechanisms currently in use on Spicer Angle-Spring Clutches: two manual and one self-adjusting mechanism. When making an internal clutch adjustment, refer to the instructions described below for your type of adjustment mechanism.

step2.para: Advance the adjusting ring as necessary with adjusting tool (International Tool Kit OEM 4319).
Re-install lockstrap and tighten bolts to 35 to 40 ft-lbs. (47.45 to 54.23 N•m) torque.

Using a 5/8" 8-point socket (older style 3/4" socket (12-point) or 3/4" box-end wrench), depress the square-headed bolt and rotate as necessary (open-end wrenches are not recommended for use with the Kwik-Adjust). The Kwik-Adjust will re-engage at each quarter turn.
Assure that the bolt head is locked in position with the bolt flats aligned with the bracket.
Remove the right bolt and loosen the left bolt one turn.
Rotate the wear compensator upward to disengage worm gear from the adjusting ring.
Rotate the assembly downward to engage worm gear with adjusting ring (adjusting ring may have to be rotated slightly to accept worm gear).
Install right bolt and tighten both bolts to 35 to 40 ft-lbs. (47.45 to 54.23 N•m) torque.
Visually check to see if actuator arm is inserted into release sleeve retainer. If assembly is properly installed, the spring will move back and forth as pedal is fully stroked.

note.para: The clutch will not compensate for wear if the actuator arm is not inserted into the release sleeve retainer, or release bearing travel is less than 1/2 inch.
